content.description: Enjoyable plates and dikes go up the first pitch to the halfway point of the route. Belay midway on some cracks, takes medium cams. Pitch 2 goes up the hand crack up and right. Hand jam and follow the crack system to its end. A great pitch, there are other variations which are in the virgin category so if you find yourself up there try em out
content.location: Left of the bunny ear route. One can start at the plates green and yellow face or start a little higher.

content.description: Moderate cracks and laybacks. Good warmup for the area
content.location: Far upper right side of the cliff band

content.description: Pitch 1 ascends same start as the DnB route but trends left to belay under the Ow section. .9 Second pitch is the crux, traverse right towards Dave n Brandon climb but traverse left at the dike.   Continue traversing until you are on the main hand crack that is a bit flared in spots. 10CD Last pich is one move of .9+ to get past short off width and 5 easy to the summit.Could be done in 2 pitches, however the zig zagging around on pitch 2 is nice to break up Descent: find rap from trees or walk down and around
content.protection: Doubles to 5 one 6 Camalot   One rope
content.location: Same start as Dave and Brandon climb but climbs the left side cracks

content.description: Locate the overhanging hand crack high up and you’ll know you are at the right route.  Stem and jam your way up dikes, cracks and awesome features to get to a  steep section of hand jams to a small belay ledge under the roof.  .10bc. Pitch 2 was not sent due to how powerful the sequence of crack is. Maybe it’s up your alley, we assume in the 5.12 range or harder. Powerful stem and finger locks , jams to finish it off with an offwidth.  .12?
content.location: Look for the huge overhanging featured wall

content.description: Wide chimney system from bottom to top, stay in it the whole way and you will be reborn again at the summit. The first pitch goes up a slabby waterfall feature that then starts with heel toe action. You can place smaller cams as you will need the big boy soon. Next section of pitch 1 I walked the number 8 cam for 30 feet of 5.8 chimney and after finding smaller cracks, I belayed inside the small cave. Pitch 2 has series of cruxes lined up at the beginning middle and top.   Thrash your way up by stemming and  jamming yourself in the chimneys. It is recommended to have the 8 camalot for the last 30 ft section as it is wide and not much gear fits
content.protection: Doubles to 5 one six and one seven or 8 Camalot
content.location: Up the slope five minutes from the Bunny Ears

content.description: West facing cliffs located high up on the ridge north east of Isle of ewe campground. You can spot them from the main dirt road but once you drive closer to the mountains you will lose sight so try and get a bearing for the gunsight saddle
